meta.content: access, access internet, access low income, directv acquisition internet, low cost internet, low income, low income internet, snap, snap internet, discount, discount internet, discounted, discounted internet, broadband, discount broadband
meta.name: keywords

meta.content: The Access program from AT&T provides discounted Internet access at affordable monthly rated for qualified customers.
meta.name: description
meta.title: Access from AT&T - Discount Internet Access

meta.content: Access from AT&T - Discount Internet Access
The Access program from AT&T provides discounted Internet access at affordable monthly rated for qualified customers.

p.b: Making Home Internet affordable for you

div.ng-init: itemList={"itemList":[{"item":"No annual commitment"},{"item":"No deposit"},{"item":"Free Install"},{"item":"Free In-home Wi-Fi"}]}

div.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.br:
$10/mo plus tax
For speeds 5Mbps - 10Mbps
$5/mo plus tax
For speeds 768Kbps – 3Mbps

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.br: You will receive the maximum speed available at your address.

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

span.p: Includes free installation, free in home Wi-Fi and a data allowance of 150GB or 1TB depending on speed available in your area. $10 charge for each additional 50GB. See details

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.i: 1Access from AT&T provides wireline Home Internet to limited income households who participate in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program or receive Supplemental Security Income benefits in California.

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.br: Now more than ever it’s important you have access to the Internet to stay in-touch with your family, friends, work and school. That’s why AT&T will continue to offer you an affordable way to connect.

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.br: In response to the public health crisis, Access from AT&T is temporarily:

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.br: • Offering two months of free service to new customers who order Access by April 30, 2020. $5/mo or $10/mo thereafter, depending on your speed.

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

span.p: • Expanding eligibility based on income2 and to households participating in National School Lunch Program/Head Start

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

span.p: • Waiving all home internet data overage fees

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.br: Learn more about AT&T’s COVID-19 response.

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

i.br: 2Household income based on 135% or less than the federal poverty guidelines.

div.class: text-centered pT10 pB10 brdTop brdBottom mT20

p.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 35px;

span.p: With Access, you can stay connected with email and social media, surf the web, access educational resources, search for jobs, and connect multiple devices.

div.class: discountedbb-steps brdTop brdRight brdLeft brdBottom rounded p20 mL10 mR10 mT10 mB10

div.p: Check below to see if Access is available at your address.

div.class: span12 brdTop brdRight brdLeft brdBottom rounded rel

div.span: Good news! You may be able to get the Access program from AT&T at:
We can’t find the Access program from AT&T available at this address:
We're having trouble pinpointing your address.

div.p: Now Apply for Access in Step 2
Service availability subject to final confirmation during the ordering and installation processes.
We need more information about your service address to complete the search. Please contact an AT&T representative at 855.220.5211. (For help in Spanish, call 855.220.5225.)
If we're not recognizing your address, here are some things you can try:

ul.li: For your street address, don't use a rural route address or a PO box.
Be sure your street address is complete and that everything is spelled correctly. Check that any numbers are in the correct order.
Include your apartment or unit number if you have one.
Check that you're using your complete 5-digit ZIP code and that the numbers are in the correct order.

div.class: mT20 mR20 mB20 mL10 pL5 clearfix

span.p:
If you qualify via income or participation in the National School Lunch or Head Start programs, you can apply online above.
Select SNAP as the qualifying program and provide proof of eligibility for your income or program.

div.class: mT10 pL12 btn btn-alt btn-small panel_row_right_column

div.p: Check your application’s status above with your confirmation number.
We’ll review your completed application and documents within 3-5 business days and contact you with next steps. Due to increased interest, we are experiencing delays in reviewing applications.

div.ng-init:
subsection.accordian={"accordian1":[{"desc":"

The Access program from AT&T provides a low-cost option for home Internet access to low-income households in the 21 states where we offer wireline home Internet services.

","title":"What is the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

Access from AT&T provides wireline Home Internet to limited income households who participate in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program or receive Supplemental Security Income benefits in California.

In response to the public health crisis, Access from AT&T is temporarily expanding eligibility based on income and to households participating in National School Lunch Program/Head Start.

","title":"How do I know if I'm eligible for the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

To qualify for Access based on your income, check the table below for the maximum household income allowed.

You will need to provide one of the items below along with the number of people living in your home.

  • Current W-2 from employer or SSA-1099
  • Paycheck stubs for most recent month
  • Social Security statement of benefits
     

Number of People in Household

Maximum Household Income to Qualify for Access

               1

$17,226

               2

$23,274

               3

$29,322

               4

$35,370

               5

$41,418

               6

$47,466

               7

$53,514

               8

$59,562

For each additional person, add

$6,048


Income based on 135% or less than the federal poverty guidelines.

","title":"How do I qualify for Access from AT&T based on income?"},{"desc":"

To qualify for Access based on National School Lunch (NSLP) or Head Start, you will need to provide a program award letter and proof of enrollment (including date, school name, school district, child’s name and address). 

","title":"How do I qualify for Access from AT&T based on National School Lunch (NSLP) or Head Start?"},{"desc":"

Access to the Internet can change lives. You can use the Internet to apply for jobs online, connect with family and friends, research health information, complete an online education—and much more. Plus, as a participant in the Access program from AT&T, you could save a lot of money on your Internet bill! In addition, you won't have to pay for installation or activation—or pay modem or gateway charges.

","title":"Why should I apply to participate in the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

No, AT&T retail stores are not able to process Access from AT&T applications or orders. You will be able to access the application on the website and submit the form online, or enter your name and address and then print the form and submit by mail. If you experience difficulties or otherwise need help with the application, you can contact an AT&T representative by phone at 855.220.5211. (For help in Spanish, call 855.220.5225.)

","title":"Can I apply for the Access program from AT&T at a local AT&T store?"},{"desc":"

AT&T does not charge a fee to apply or process applications for this program.

","title":"How much does it cost to apply? Is there an application or processing fee for the Access from AT&T Program?"},{"desc":"

Access from AT&T service includes a Wi-Fi–capable modem or gateway that broadcasts a wireless Wi-Fi signal inside your home, allowing you to extend the reach of your wireline Internet service. You can access this wireless Wi-Fi signal on a variety of devices that are Wi-Fi compatible, including laptops, tablets, smartphones, and many more.

","title":"The program materials say that an in-home Wi-Fi gateway is included at no extra cost. What does that mean?"},{"desc":"

AT&T Wi-Fi Basic service is included for Access from AT&T customers at no extra cost. You can connect your Wi-Fi enabled devices away from home, at thousands of AT&T Wi-Fi hotspots nationwide. For complete details, visit attwifi.com

","title":"The program materials say that Access from AT&T service includes access to AT&T’s entire national Wi-Fi hotspot network at no extra cost. What does that mean?"},{"desc":"

"Wireline home Internet service" refers to AT&T's wireline Broadband Internet Access Service, which is delivered to a fixed location over a physical wire or cable.

","title":"What exactly do you mean by wireline home Internet service?"},{"desc":"

"Fixed Internet service" refers to AT&T's Fixed Broadband Internet Access Service, which includes both wireline and wireless broadband Internet access service provided at a fixed location.

","title":"What do you mean by fixed Internet service?"},{"desc":"

The 21-state service area is the broad area (also known as footprint) where AT&T provides wireline services. You can view a map of this service area here. Actual service availability and speeds may vary by individual address.

","title":"How do I find out if I'm located in AT&T's 21-state service area?"},{"desc":"

You can view a list of the required information you'll need to provide here.

","title":"What information will I need to provide to participate in the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

You may provide either a Social Security number, a taxpayer ID number, or a tribal ID number.

","title":"Can I provide a taxpayer ID instead of a Social Security number?"},{"desc":"

After we receive and process your application, a letter indicating your application status will be mailed to you.

","title":"After I sign up for the offer and provide the required information, how will I know if I qualify?"},{"desc":"

SNAP helps low-income individuals and families obtain a more nutritious diet by supplementing their income with SNAP benefits.

","title":"What is the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)?"},{"desc":"

The U.S. Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program used to be known as the Food Stamp Program. It's a nationwide program, but each state administers the program on behalf of the federal government. If you receive food benefits through your state government (EBT, food card), you're probably a SNAP participant.

","title":"How do I know whether I'm a SNAP participant?"},{"desc":"

Go to the USDA SNAP website here. On the SNAP website, you'll find instructions on how to apply.

","title":"How do I enroll in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program?"},{"desc":"

If anyone in your household is a Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) participant, your household is eligible for the Access program from AT&T if at least one of the Access from AT&T speeds is available where you live.

","title":"What if only one person in my household is a SNAP participant? Would I still be eligible to participate in the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

Information about the SSI program is available here.

","title":"What is SSI?"},{"desc":"

California SSI recipients are not eligible for SNAP benefits because they receive a State supplement to their SSI benefits in lieu of SNAP benefits.  For this reason, AT&T decided to expand program eligibility to California SSI recipients under the same requirements that apply to SNAP participants.

","title":"Why do California households qualify based on SSI participation, but not households in other states?"},{"desc":"

You may submit an application for Access from AT&T based on either the SSI benefits received by your uncle, or the SNAP benefits received by your sister.  You will only have to provide information for one of these individuals, and you may choose either.  However, only one account will be available at your address.

","title":"I am a California resident and I live with my uncle, who receives SSI benefits, and my sister, who is a SNAP participant. How do I qualify for Access from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

No. Only one AT&T Internet account per household can be included in the Access program from AT&T. You'll need to choose which account you want to include.

","title":"I have more than one Internet account with AT&T. If I'm approved for participation in the Access program from AT&T, will all my Internet accounts be included?"},{"desc":"

The Access program from AT&T provides discounted wireline Internet service; Lifeline provides discounted phone service. The Access program from AT&T and Lifeline are two completely separate programs, each with its own eligibility requirements. It may be possible to receive discounted services through both the Access program from AT&T and Lifeline. Similarly, it may be possible to be eligible for one program but not the other. For details on Lifeline, visit att.com/lifeline.

","title":"I’m currently a Lifeline customer and get wireline phone service at home from AT&T at a discount. Does this new program replace Lifeline?"},{"desc":"

Five speed tiers are currently available under the program. AT&T will assign you a speed of 10, 5, 3, or 1.5Mbps or 768Kbps, whichever is the fastest available at your address.

 

","title":"Which Internet speeds are available with the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

No. This offer applies only to wireline home Internet service in AT&T’s 21-state service area.

","title":"Does this offer apply to wireless (cellular) Internet service?"},{"desc":"

AT&T will send you a self-installation kit with simple step-by-step instructions, making it easy to complete the installation process yourself. In most cases, customers can complete the installation process themselves. If you need additional help after attempting self-installation, you may request a technician (at no charge) to assist with installation. For additional installation assistance, please contact an AT&T representative at 855.220.5211. (For help in Spanish, call 855.220.5225.)

","title":"Will someone need to come to my home to install service?"},{"desc":"

No, there is no charge. AT&T will send you a self-installation kit with step-by-step instructions. In most cases, customers can complete the installation process themselves. If you need additional help after attempting self-installation, you may request a technician to assist with installation. For additional installation assistance, please contact an AT&T representative at 855.220.5211. (For help in Spanish, call 855.220.5225.)

","title":"If I need to call in a technician for installation assistance at my home, will there be a charge?"},{"desc":"

There are five possible program speed tiers.* If you're assigned a speed of 10 or 5Mbps, you'll pay only $10 per month.** And if your speed is 3 or 1.5Mbps or 768Kbps, you'll pay just $5 per month. You'll be assigned the highest speed available where you live. 

","title":"If I participate in the Access program from AT&T, what's my monthly rate?"},{"desc":"

Service will include a monthly data allowance of either 150GB or 1TB of data per month depending on the type and speed of service you receive. If you exceed your monthly data plan allowance, you will be automatically charged $10 for each 50GB of data usage in excess of your data plan, even if less than 50 gigabytes is used. For more information, go to att.com/internet-usage.

","title":"Will my speed tier come with a data allowance?"},{"desc":"

No. This program applies only to the highest of the three program speed tiers available at your address. This speed tier will be automatically assigned to you by AT&T.

","title":"Suppose I'm assigned a speed of 5Mbps. Can I switch to 3Mbps so that my monthly bill is $5 instead of $10?"},{"desc":"

Your service under the program starts when your Access from AT&T order is completed. That may be the same day you call in to activate your discount (if you have existing AT&T service)—or at a later date (if you are newly establishing wireline Internet service). Your customer service representative will advise you of your service activation date when you call to place your order.

","title":"If I'm approved, when does my Access program from AT&T start?"},{"desc":"

No deposit is required to establish Internet service under the Access program from AT&T.

","title":"Do I need to pay a deposit to get service?"},{"desc":"

As part of standard AT&T policy, all orders for new service are subject to a credit check. Results of the credit check will not impact your ability to obtain Internet service under the Access program from AT&T.

","title":"Will AT&T conduct a credit check when I apply for service?"},{"desc":"

You may be able to keep bundled pricing for other AT&T services even if you switch your Internet service to the Access program from AT&T. For complete details, please call an AT&T representative at 855.220.5211. (For Spanish, call 855.220.5225.)

","title":"I currently have a bundle of AT&T services. If I get service through Access from AT&T, does the bundle pricing stay the same for the other products?"},{"desc":"

No, online billing is not required.

","title":"Am I required to sign up for online billing to participate in the Access program from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

There is no term commitment for services provided under the Access program from AT&T. Customers may cancel at any time by calling the number on their bill, or by calling the Access from AT&T dedicated call center at 855.220.5211. (For help in Spanish, call 855.220.5225.)

","title":"Can services under the Access program from AT&T be cancelled within the same year a household signs up? What is the process for cancelling? "},{"desc":"

An existing Access from AT&T customer moving to a new address within the state and within AT&T’s wireline serving area should have that transaction handled by the Access from AT&T dedicated call center at 855.220.5211 (in Spanish, 855.220.5225) to ensure the discount stays on their account. No re-certification is required for a service address change, unless the customer is within their annual re-certification window.

","title":"If a customer moves to a different address while they have service under the Access program from AT&T, will they be required to re-certify eligibility for the program?"},{"desc":"

SNAP benefits are administered by the local offices of each state.  You will need to contact the new state local office and receive verification of SNAP benefits in that state.  As long as that state is within AT&T’s 21 state footprint you then can apply for Access from AT&T.

","title":"What if I have approved SNAP benefits from one state, but have moved to a different state. Can I still qualify for Access from AT&T?"},{"desc":"

Customers should contact the Access from AT&T dedicated call center at 855.220.5211 (in Spanish, 855.220.5225) to confirm the equipment return requirements for their specific account. Failure to adhere to the applicable equipment return requirements could result in the application of fees.

","title":"If a customer disconnects service under the Access program from AT&T, will they be required to return the modem or gateway equipment? If they do not return the equipment, is there a fee?"},{"desc":"

When you submitted your application, you should have received a confirmation number. Click HERE and use the confirmation number to track your application’s status.

","title":"Can I check the status of my application? I have a confirmation number, where can I go to check on my application?"}],"accordian2":[{"desc":"

This offer will be in effect for four years. It will begin in April 2016 and continue until April 2020. Once you are an AT&T Access customer, your service will automatically renew each year the program continues. If you do not participate in the Qualifying Program, contact us to discuss other Internet service programs.  Participants who qualify for the Access program from AT&T after April 2019 may continue in the program for 12 months from the date of activation.

","title":"How long will the Access program from AT&T be available?"},{"desc":"

You can continue to participate while the offer is in effect as long as your household continues to meet the qualification requirements for the offer.

","title":"Is my continued participation guaranteed?"},{"desc":"

If we find that you no longer meet the requirements for participation in the Access program from AT&T, we'll remove your program discount and bill you at regular rates for your Internet service unless you:

  • Tell us to cancel the service or
  • Provide documentation showing that you do in fact meet the requirements.
","title":"What happens if I no longer meet the qualification requirements?"},{"desc":"

Access from AT&T customers need to meet the qualification requirements at all times, and having at least one SNAP participant in a household is necessary for continued participation in the Access program from AT&T. If we learn that the person whose SNAP information was used to apply for the program no longer lives in your household, we'll give you the opportunity to:

  • Provide documentation showing that someone else in your household is a SNAP participant or
  • Notify us that you intend to cancel your Internet service or
  • Take no further action, in which case we'll remove your program discount and bill you at regular rates.
","title":"The only SNAP participant in my household will be moving out before it’s time to re-certify. Will I be able to continue participating in the Access program from AT&T?"}]};

div.h2: Why get the Access program from AT&T?

div.p: Technology has the ability to revolutionize education and empower lives, but only for those who can connect to it. Access to the Internet brings with it an opportunity to apply for jobs online, connect with family and friends, access virtual library shelves, research health questions, complete an online education—and a whole lot more. The Access program from AT&T provides an affordable way for low-income consumers to take advantage of these opportunities.
Want to learn more about the Access program from AT&T before finding out whether you're eligible? Check out the information below.

h2.class: m0 p0 bgNone toggle-header accordion border-dotted align-left mNone

div.h2: After your Access program from AT&T begins

div.p: Have questions about how the Access program from AT&T will work once you've started? See the information below.

h2.class: m0 p0 bgNone toggle-header accordion border-dotted align-left mNone

div.h2: Get online tools from Digital You!

div.p: Whether you're searching for a low-cost computer to get online at home, your child is starting to explore the Internet to help complete schoolwork, or you want to boost your online skills for everything from paying bills to applying for jobs—Digital You can help! Created in collaboration with Common Sense Media, Digital You can show you how to increase your confidence, skills, privacy, and safety as you connect online. Check out these tools today!

h2.class: m0 p0 bgNone toggle-header accordion border-dotted align-left mNone

div.p: Technology has the ability to revolutionize education and empower lives, but only for those who can connect to it. Access to the Internet brings with it an opportunity to apply for jobs online, connect with family and friends, access virtual library shelves, research health questions, complete an online education—and a whole lot more.
The Access program from AT&T provides an affordable way for low-income consumers to take advantage of these opportunities.
Please consider sharing information about this valuable program in your offices as well as in your mailings and other communications with those who might be eligible.
Visit our partner website to access a collection of downloadable resources, including flyers, email templates, FAQs, and more.

h2.class: m0 p0 bgNone toggle-header accordion border-dotted align-left mNone

div.p: *Internet speed claims represent maximum network service capability speeds. Actual customer speeds may vary and are not guaranteed. Actual speeds vary based on factors including site traffic, content provider server capacity, internal network management factors, and device capabilities and the use of certain other AT&T services. For more information, go to att.com/speed101.

**All prices are plus tax. Service will include a monthly data allowance of either 150GB or 1TB of data per month depending on the type and speed of service you receive. If you exceed your monthly data plan allowance, you will be charged $10 for each 50GB of data usage in excess of your data plan, even if less than 50 gigabytes is used. For more information, go to att.com/internet-usage.
div.div: *Internet speed claims represent maximum network service capability speeds. Actual customer speeds may vary and are not guaranteed. Actual speeds vary based on factors including site traffic, content provider server capacity, internal network management factors, and device capabilities and the use of certain other AT&T services. Max speeds may not be realized if 2 or more HD shows viewed at same time. For more information, go to
